items.description: A display. A TermBar window will be shown on each configured display.

Id.description: The display ID. These can be viewed in the TermBar settings.

TermBar.description: The TermBar configuration for the display.

Background.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the background.

CornerRadius.description: The corner radius to apply to windows.

TextColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for text.

AccentBackground.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the background of accent items. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use as an accent. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

SelectedBackground.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the background of selected items. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

SelectedColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for selected items. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

ClickedBackground.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the background of clicked items. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

ClickedColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for clicked items. Set to null to use the default system behavior.

HighPriorityWindows.description: An ordered list of window process names that should be pinned, in this order, at the beginning of the window list. Set to null to disable this behavior.

LowPriorityWindows.description: An ordered list of window process names that should be pinned, in this order, at the end of the window list. Set to null to disable this behavior. If a process name is in LowPriorityWindows and in HighPriorityWindows, HighPriorityWindows takes precedence.

SortGroupsAlphabetically.description: Whether groups of windows with the same process name should be sorted alphabetically. If false, windows are simply added to the window list in the order they were created (or, when starting, in the order they are reported by the operating system).

ProcessIconMap.description: The map of window process names to ProcessIconMappings to apply to windows. Set to null to disable this behavior.

additionalProperties.description: A window list process icon mapping, which allows configuration of window attributes per process name.

IconColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the window icon. Set to null to fall back to the window list module’s AccentColor.

Icon.description: The text to use as the window icon. Set to null to fall back to the window list module’s Icon.

WindowNameIconMap.description: The map of window name regular expressions to WindowNameIconMappings to apply to windows with this process name. Set to null to disable this functionality. These override IconColor and Icon.

additionalProperties.description: A window name icon mapping, which allows configuration of window attributes per regular expression matching the window name.

IconColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the window icon. Set to null to fall back to the window list module’s AccentColor.

Icon.description: The text to use as the window icon. Set to null to fall back to the window list module’s Icon.

Margin.description: The margin, in pixels, between the top or bottom screen edge and the TermBar window.

Padding.description: The padding, in pixels, between components of the TermBar.

MinimumWidthPercentage.description: The minimum width, as a percentage of the total screen width, of the TermBar window. Must be between 0.0 and 1.0.

Height.description: The TermBar window height, in pixels.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the clock icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the clock icon.

TimeFormat.description: The time format to use for the clock. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.

UpdateInterval.description: The clock update interval, in milliseconds.

Calendar.description: Clock module calendar configuration. Set to null to disable the calendar. The calendar can be displayed by clicking on the clock module.

TodayDayFormat.description: The date format to use for today’s day in the calendar. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.

TodayDateFormat.description: The date format to use for today’s date in the calendar. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.

OtherDateFormat.description: The date format to use for months other than the current month in the calendar. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.

OtherMonthFormat.description: The date format to use for months other than the current month in the last month and next month buttons in the calendar. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the CPU icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the CPU icon.

Format.description: The numeric format to use for the CPU percentage. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.

Round.description: Whether to round the CPU percentage before formatting.

UpdateInterval.description: The CPU usage update interval, in milliseconds.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the GPU icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the GPU icon.

Format.description: The numeric format to use for the GPU percentage. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.

Round.description: Whether to round the GPU percentage before formatting.

UpdateInterval.description: The GPU usage update interval, in milliseconds.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for launcher icons by default.

Icon.description: The text to use as launcher icons by default.

Name.description: The name of the launcher entry. This is always displayed as a tooltip and is optionally displayed in the launcher button if DisplayName is true.

CommandArguments.description: Arguments to the command to shell execute. Set to null for no arguments.

DisplayName.description: Whether to display Name in the launcher button.

IconColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the launcher icon. Set to null to use matches in ProcessIconMap and fall back to AccentColor.

Icon.description: The text to use as the launcher icon. Set to null to use matches in ProcessIconMap and fall back to Icon.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the memory icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the memory icon.

Format.description: The numeric format to use for the memory percentage. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.

Round.description: Whether to round the memory percentage before formatting.

UpdateInterval.description: The memory usage update interval, in milliseconds.

anyOf.description: A TermBar static text display configuration.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the icon.

anyOf.description: A TermBar terminal configuration. For all objects that accept a null value, a value of null means the default TerminalControl behavior takes effect, unless otherwise noted.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use as an accent.

Icon.description: The text to use as the terminal icon.

VisualBellIcon.description: The text to use as the terminal visual bell icon when the visual bell is ringing. Has no effect if UseVisualBell is false.

Command.description: The command to run in the terminal. This is typically a shell.

RestartOnExit.description: Whether to restart Command when it exits normally.

DefaultWindowTitle.description: The default terminal window title. The terminal window title can be viewed as a tooltip of the terminal icon.

Rows.description: The number of rows in the terminal.

Columns.description: The number of columns in the terminal.

FontFamily.description: The font family to use in the terminal. Set to null to use the TermBar font family.

FontSize.description: The font size to use in the terminal. Set to null to use the TermBar font size.

TabWidth.description: The default tab width in the terminal. (Practically speaking, this is virtually irrelevant today.)

TextAntialiasing.description: The text antialiasing style to apply in the terminal. Unicode box-drawing characters are always drawn without antialiasing.

FullColorEmoji.description: Whether to draw emoji in full color in the terminal using the Segoe UI Emoji font.

UseBackgroundColorErase.description: Whether to use background color erase in the terminal. See https://sunaku.github.io/vim-256color-bce.html for a description of what this does.

BackgroundIsInvisible.description: Whether to render the default background color as invisible in the terminal.

UseVisualBell.description: Whether to use the visual bell in the terminal. If this is true, VisualBellIcon is displayed for VisualBellDisplayTime milliseconds when the terminal bell rings. If this is false, a sound plays instead.

VisualBellDisplayTime.description: The number of milliseconds to display the visual bell in the terminal. Does nothing if UseVisualBell is false.

UseContextMenu.description: Whether to show the context menu when right clicking the terminal.

UseExtendedContextMenu.description: Whether to show the extended context menu when right clicking the terminal. Does nothing if UseContextMenu is false.

CursorStyle.description: The default cursor style to use in the terminal.

CursorThickness.description: The cursor thickness in the terminal, as a fraction of the font size, between 0.0 and 1.0. Does not affect the block cursor.

CursorBlink.description: Whether the cursor should blink by default in the terminal.

CursorBlinkRate.description: The number of milliseconds that pass between the blinking cursor being displayed in the terminal and hidden. Has no effect if CursorBlink is false.

CursorColor.description: The cursor color in the terminal.

ScrollbackLines.description: The number of scrollback lines in the terminal.

LinesPerScrollback.description: The number of scrollback lines per large scrollback in the terminal. A large scrollback is invoked with Shift-Page Up and reversed with Shift-Page Down.

LinesPerSmallScrollback.description: The number of scrollback lines per small scrollback in the terminal. A small scrollback is invoked with Shift-Up and reversed with Shift-Down.

LinesPerWheelScrollback.description: The number of scrollback lines per mouse wheel scroll in the terminal. A mouse wheel scroll is invoked with mouse wheel up and reversed with mouse wheel down.

CopyOnMouseUp.description: Whether to copy selected text in the terminal when the left mouse button is released. If this is false, the selection can be copied with Ctrl-Shift-C.

PasteOnMiddleClick.description: Whether to paste text in the terminal when the terminal is middle clicked. Text can also be pasted with Ctrl-Shift-V.

PasteOnRightClick.description: Whether to paste text in the terminal when the terminal is right clicked. Text can also be pasted with Ctrl-Shift-V. If this is true, the context menu can be displayed by right clicking the terminal while pressing Ctrl (assuming UseContextMenu is true).

CopyNewline.description: The line ending to use when copying text in the terminal.

Colors.description: The ANSI colors to use in the terminal.

DefaultColors.description: The default ANSI colors to use in the terminal.

DefaultBackgroundColor.description: The default background color to use in the terminal.

DefaultForegroundColor.description: The default foreground color to use in the terminal.

DefaultUnderlineColor.description: The default underline color to use in the terminal.

StandardColors.description: The standard (non-bright) ANSI colors to use in the terminal.

BrightColors.description: The bright ANSI colors to use in the terminal.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the volume icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as the volume icon.

MutedIcon.description: The text to use as the muted volume icon.

Format.description: The numeric format to use for the volume percentage. These are documented in https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.

Muted.description: Text to be displayed in place of the volume level when muted. Set to null to always display the volume level.

VolumeInteraction.description: Volume module interaction configuration. Set to null to disable interaction.

ClickToToggleMute.description: Whether clicking the volume module toggles the mute state.

ScrollToAdjust.description: Whether scrolling over the volume module adjusts the volume level.

PercentPerScroll.description: The volume level change per scroll. Does nothing if ScrollToAdjust is false.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for window icon colors by default.

Icon.description: The text to use as window icons by default.

Windows.description: Windows configuration. Set to null to disable these features and allow system default behaviors to take place.

FixedLength.description: The fixed length of windows, in pixels. Set to null for variable size.

MaxLength.description: The maximum length of a window, in pixels. Set to null for no maximum length.

NiceTruncation.description: Whether the window name should be truncated with … if it’s too long.

ScrollIntoView.description: Whether to scroll the window list to show the selected window.

Order.description: The order in which the module should be displayed on the TermBar.

Expand.description: Whether the module should expand to take up as much space as possible.

AccentColor.description: The Catppuccin color to use for the dropdown icon color.

DropdownIcon.description: The text to use as the dropdown icon.

Icon.description: The text to use as window icons by default.

StartDirectory.description: The directory to change to when starting. Set to null to keep the directory inherited from the parent process.
